parsed.internal_thinking: The board analysis reveals several high-value locations. Node 20 stands out as an exceptional starting position, offering a total of 12 pips across three essential resources: Wood (11), Brick (6), and Sheep (8). This combination is ideal for early-game expansion, providing the necessary materials for roads and further settlements. While Node 43 offers a higher pip count (13), it is heavily concentrated in Wheat (Wh6, Wh9, Wh9), which could lead to a resource imbalance early on. Node 42 is also strong with 12 pips of Wheat and Ore (Wh9, Wh9, O5), but securing the Wood-Brick-Sheep engine on Node 20 first ensures I have the mobility to claim a Wheat/Ore spot in the second half of the setup phase. My strategy will be to build towards the nearby ports or towards the Wheat/Ore clusters in the south to balance my production. Node 20's proximity to Node 10 and 19 also provides flexibility for road placement. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Claimed Node 20 (6-8-11). Target for second settlement should be high Wheat/Ore (like Node 42 or 43) to balance the economy. Watch Bob and Charlie's placements to see if they block the path to the 3:1 port at Node 9 or the southern expansion.
parsed.say_outloud: Starting off with some solid production on that 6-8-11. Good luck everyone!
